gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat

Class TermAnnotation

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat.AbstractAnnotation
      • gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat.TermAnnotation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Annotation, java.lang.Comparable<Annotation>

    public class TermAnnotation
extends AbstractAnnotation
    The class to represent a single term annotation. A term is an atomic unit of meaning that should be treated as a single unit. A term can potentially cover non-adjacent units, that's why the span is specified as a list.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • TermAnnotation

        public TermAnnotation(java.lang.String id,
                      java.lang.String docId,
                      java.lang.String type,
                      SpanList span,
                      java.lang.String text)
        Creates a TermAnnotation object.
        Parameters:
        id - annotation id
        docId - document id
        type - the semantic type (e.g., Drug, Disease)
        span - the character offsets for the annotations
        text - text covered by the annotation

      • TermAnnotation

        public TermAnnotation(java.lang.String id,
                      java.lang.String docId,
                      java.lang.String type,
                      SpanList span,
                      java.lang.String text,
                      Reference reference)
        Creates a TermAnnotation object with a reference concept.
        Parameters:
        id - annotation id
        docId - document id
        type - the semantic type
        span - the character offsets for the annotations
        text - text covered by the annotation
        reference - the concept information

      • TermAnnotation

                      java.lang.String type,
                      SpanList span,

                      java.util.List<Reference> references)
        Creates a TermAnnotation object with a list of reference concepts.
        Parameters:
        id - annotation id
        docId - document id
        type - the semantic type
        span - the character offsets for the annotations
        text - text covered by the annotation
        references - the concepts

      • exactMatch

        public boolean exactMatch(Annotation a)
        Checks whether the term annotation matches exactly another annotation by checking the character offsets and semantic types
        Parameters:
        a - annotation to compare with
        Returns:
        true if exact match

      • approximateMatch

        public boolean approximateMatch(Annotation a)
        Checks whether the term annotation approximately matches another annotation. Semantic type match is required but the character offset overlap is sufficient.
        Parameters:
        a - annotation to compare with
        Returns:
        true if approximate match

      • spanMatch

        public boolean spanMatch(Annotation a)
        Checks whether the term annotation matches another annotation based simply on spans.
        Parameters:
        a - annotation to compare with
        Returns:
        true if span match

      • referenceMatch

        public boolean referenceMatch(boolean approximateMatch,
                              Annotation a)
        Checks whether the normalized term annotation matches another normalized annotation. Exact or approximate match can still be specified.
        Parameters:
        approximateMatch - whether to perform approximate match for offsets
        a - annotation to compare with
        Returns:
        true if the annotations are normalized to the same concept
